titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I finished the "Open Letter" for the

, and sent it Carter together with the report of my Congress Sermon from the "Church Family Newspaper". The MS. of the latter was sent to the Secretary of the Ipswich Church Congress for the official Report.
came to see about his precious "Retreat House", and stayed to lunch.
arrived in the course of the morning, and walked round the Park in the afternoon.
Cecil Ferens, Colin Kennedy, Lionel and I motored to Stillington, where I admitted the
to the perpetual curacy. The Church was crowded, and there was a fair muster of the local clergy. I was pleased with the service. We returned to Auckland after the service, giving
a lift so far on his way to New Shildon.
Some more newspapers comments on my Congress Sermon were sent to me. These are very polite to me

personally, but express a kind of pained surprise that so normally reasonable a person could have given utterance to such monstrous opinions. They are so obviously written on the basis of a few sentences from the sermon, that they have no kind of value as criticisms of the sermon itself.
